docs.snippet: Recently mushroom hunters have been sharing photos of the fly agaric, which has a reputation for strange and dangerous effects when ingested by other living things.

headline.print_headline: Red October: A Mushroom Best Suited for Gnomes, and Instagram
headline.main: A Mushroom Out of a Fairy Tale That You Might Find in the Forest

docs.snippet: A spokesman said President Putin makes his own decisions, and besides, never knew that Michael T. Flynn had asked Russia not to retaliate for sanctions imposed by President Obama.

headline.main: Kremlin Denies Flynn Influenced Decision on Sanctions

docs.snippet: This holiday season, consider men’s wear with a tinge of humor and whimsy: shirts with satirical prints, jazzy sneakers and peekaboo denim. Even your dog can get in on the fun with colorful accessories.

headline.print_headline: Festive Footwear and Other Whimsical Duds for the Holidays
headline.main: Festive Footwear and Other Whimsical Duds for the Holidays

docs.snippet: Ms. Page said the director had suggested crudely that another woman have sex with her “to make her realize she’s gay.”

docs.snippet: The Washington Post editor Ben Bradlee’s life is the subject of a new documentary. And in the age of Uber, the “Cash Cab” rides again.

headline.main: What’s on TV Monday: ‘The Newspaperman’ and the Return of ‘Cash Cab’

docs.snippet: An award-winning playwright argues that the in-the-moment interplay between actors and audience can help us cope with an increasingly virtual world.

headline.main: An Antidote to Digital Dehumanization? Live Theater

docs.snippet: Robert Edwards, the student’s stepfather, was charged with a second-degree felony, although officials said they did not believe he planned to carry out the acts depicted.
